document_data.name: Mosque of Najm the Adventurous
document_data.mainbody: The '''Mosque of Najm the Adventurous''' was located in [[Huzuz]] in [[1367 DR]].{{AQ-time}}
document_data.Location: This temple could be found in the [[Pilgrims' District]] of the City of Delights.
document_data.Structure: A large worship area allowed worshipers of [[Najm]] to regale other followers with tales of adventure. Showrooms housed rare treasures brought back from these adventures.
document_data.Inhabitants: High Priest Imam [[Effat]] was the head of the mosque. He supervised around 200 lesser ranking priests of Najm and other laymen.
document_data.Activities:
Followers of Najm were encouraged to explore the world and bring back tales of their exploits.

Items held in the showrooms included a [[Spelljammer|spelljammer helm]], an emerald from a palace from [[Kara-Tur]], a stuffed [[beholder]], a shield of a [[Purple Dragons|Purple Dragon]], a red robe from a land called [[Thay]], and a statue of a wizard named [[Elminster]].

[[Divination]] magic was practiced here and could be cast for a fee.

Followers of Najm were encouraged to prove their faith by crossing a small pit on a walkway that was only several inches wide. True followers performed the feat while blind-folded.
